intro: Pavetta hierniana, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when ripe. Pavetta hierniana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
